questions.question: Who opens the play with spell-like words which imply that things aren't always what they seem?
(I.I) Three Witches: [blank] is foul, and foul is [blank]
Who mirrors the witches lines in their own first line on stage (I.III)?

choices.answer: Macbeth - 'It's a foul day, but also quite fair'
Macbeth - 'So foul and fair a day I have not seen'
Duncan - 'Witches seem fair but they are foul'

questions.question: When the Sergeant reports to Duncan from the battle field, how does he describe Macbeth?

choices.answer: Amazing he was and truely brave
For brave Macbeth â€“ well he deserves that name
He was an murderer, bloody and cruel
Twas Macbeth which sav'd the day!

questions.question: (I.III) Witches: All hail, Macbeth, hail to thee, Thane of Glamis... Thane of Cawdor...[blank]
(Act 1 Scene 3) How does Macbeth initially feel about the witches?
(I.III) Macbeth: This supernatural soliciting [blank]

choices.answer: Cannot be ill, cannot be good

questions.question: Duncan makes Malcolm Prince of Cumberland (heir to throne). How does Macbeth's react?

choices.answer: Confused - how does this link into the witches'  prophecy?
Discouraged - now Malcolm is in the way, should he give up?
Worried - he has murderous thoughts which worry him.
Determined - He wants to become King ... no matter the cost.

questions.question: (Act 1 Scene 5) Macbeth writes to his wife for advice about the witches. How does she react?

choices.answer: She's excited about the idea of him (and her) gaining power
She ignores the letter because she hates Macbeth
She's worried that Macbeth is too nice to persue power

questions.question: (I.V) Lady Macbeth:Glamis thou art, and Cawdor, and shalt be What thou are promis'd; yet[blank]

choices.answer: I fear thy nature ... too full o'th'milk of human kindness
I fear thou are too soft to do the job needed to be done
I fear that I will have to kill the King for you
I worry though nature be too soft

questions.question: (I.V) Lady Macbeth: Come, you spirits ... [blank] ... fill me ... topfull of direst cruelty

choices.answer: take the milk of my human kindness

questions.question: (I.VI) Lady Macbeth: look like [blank], but be the [blank] under't
(I.VII) When Macbeth doesn't want to continue the murder plot, how does Lady macbeth react?

choices.answer: She's furious and wants a divorce
She says she'll do the murder for him
She's supportive and says she'll help
She provokes Macbeth by insulting him and his masculinity

questions.question: (Act 2 Scene 1) How can we tell that Macbeth starts feeling bad about the plan?

choices.answer: Macbeth has a vision of a floating dagger which worries him
Macbeth throws a dagger at his wife
Macbeth tells Duncan that his wife wants him to murder him

questions.question: (II.I) Macbeth: Is this a [blank]

choices.answer: bloody hands I see in front of me?
ghost I see in my castle?
dagger which I see before me, the handle toward my hand?

questions.question: (Act3 Scene2 & Act3 Scene4) What does Macbeth realise after he's murdered Duncan?

choices.answer: Killing is fun and he wants to do it more
He has to confess to murdering the King
His paranoia and ambition are conflicting & driving him mad
He's on a slippery slop - murder will lead to more death

questions.question: (III.II) Macbeth: O, full of [blank] is my mind, dear wife!
(III.IV) Macbeth: It will have [blank]: they say [blank] will have [blank]
(Act 5 Scene 1) As the play goes on, what happens to Lady Macbeth?

choices.answer: She's blood-thirsty and is always seeking another victim
Her own guilt and paranoia are driving her mad
She is more and more attracted to Macbeth and his power
She still worships the devils she called on at the start

questions.question: (V.I) Lady Macbeth: Out [blank] out, I say!
(Act 5 Scene 5) What happens to Lady Macbeth in the end?

choices.answer: She kills Macbeth and becomes Queen
She gives birth to a son and worries the child is evil
She commits suicide off stage-totally seperated from Macbeth
Macbeth kills her out of anger

questions.question: (V.V) Macbeth: She should have [blank], There would have been a time for such a word.
(V.V) Macbeth: Life's ... is a tale told by [blank] full of sound and fury Signifying nothing.
What impossible things do the witches predict which make Macbeth so confident?

choices.answer: Macbeth can only fall when Birnam Wood moves to Dusinane
Macbeth can never be harmed by someone born from a woman
Macbeth cannot be killed in a battle he doesn't agree to

questions.question: (V.VIII) Macbeth: I bear a [blank]
What happens to Macbeth in the end?

choices.answer: Macduff arrests him and Malcolm beheads him
